Steps.Message: Update at 06:13 - Our engineers have identified a fault with a piece of equipment within your local substation. We know that with the current pandemic, our customers are more worried now than ever about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 6 hours in the fridge, and between 15-24 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. For more information, please see your terms of connection, which are usually provided by your supplier, but are available here https://bit.ly/2VvgXFi. Thank you.

We became aware of this power cut at 04:16. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

Logs.Comment: Update at 06:13 - Our engineers have identified a fault with a piece of equipment within your local substation. We know that with the current pandemic, our customers are more worried now than ever about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 6 hours in the fridge, and between 15-24 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. For more information, please see your terms of connection, which are usually provided by your supplier, but are available here https://bit.ly/2VvgXFi. Thank you.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A piece of network equipment had a fault on our high voltage electricity network, causing an area wide power cut.
